qas.question: What did the Gulf War inadvertently do in the early 1990s?

answers.text: worked to radicalize the Islamist movement

qas.question: Whose occupation of Kuwait did the US military personal seek to put an end to?

qas.question: What did the Gulf War do on purpose in the early 1990s?
Whose occupation of Kuwait did Iraq military personal seek to put an end to?
Up until 1990, Saudi Arabia played an unimportant role in restraining what groups?
What monarchy did Eastern troops protect?
Whose puppet did Islamists support the Saudi regime of being?

context: Another factor in the early 1990s that <a0_0><b5_0>worked to <a0_1><a0_2>radicalize the Islamist movement<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> was the Gulf War, which brought several hundred thousand US and allied non-Muslim military personnel to Saudi Arabian soil to put an end to <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>Saddam Hussein<a1_0/>'s<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/> occupation of Kuwait. Prior to 1990 Saudi Arabia played an important role in restraining the many <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>Islamist<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> groups that received its aid. But when Saddam, secularist and Ba'athist dictator of neighboring Iraq, attacked Saudi Arabia (his enemy in the war), western troops came to protect the <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b8_0>Saudi<b8_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> monarchy.
